intro: Phyllanthus xiphophorus, commonly known as the African starwort, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are small and clustered in cymes. Phyllanthus xiphophorus is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various health purposes.
